etymologies: mid 16th century; earliest use found in Manifest Detection Diceplay. Origin uncertain; perhaps from Fulham, the name of a borough of London (formerly a village on the Thames; recorded in the 16th and 17th centuries in forms Fullam, Fullom, etc.)

definitions: A die loaded at one corner, either to favour a throw of 4, 5, or 6 ("high fulham") or to favour a throw of 1, 2, or 3 ("low fulham").
